channel.title: Using ::starter
channel.description: Idk how it happens but when you log from my server and log back in your able too use ::starter again, and again...etc.Anyway i can stop this from happening?

item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Jesus, fuck. No-one understands and they’ll never want to.

Read full topic

item.title: Using ::starter
item.dc:creator: @Kalphiter Kalphiter
item.description:
@Kalphiter wrote:

I found this in my source, where the “starter = 1;” and “starter == 1” tell it to only give the starter once:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) { if (starter == 0) { addItem(995, 3000000); sendMessage("The starter packet for W/eScape players!"); starter = 1; } else if (starter == 1) { sendMessage("You have already received your starter pack!"); }

Read full topic

item.title: Using ::starter
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Nets8, post:8, topic:184642”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=246336.msg2075986#msg2075986 date=1204090383]

Idk how it happens but when you log from my server and log back in your able too use ::starter again, and again…etc.Anyway i can stop this from happening?

Since your server is built from Winterlove’s, it has multi threading for each Player connected. Each Player is it’s own Client object, and inside each Client, there is an integer set to 0. Each time you log out, and in, you get a new client object, hence the only way to do that would not to use an integer, but a HashSet/ArrayList. Just declare one in class Player, and add to it, invoking add(Object) every time someone uses the command.
[/quote]

WTF are you talking about?[/quote]
… You obviously don’t understand.

Read full topic

item.title: Using ::starter
item.dc:creator: @Nets8 Nets8
item.description:
@Nets8 wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:7, topic:184642”][quote author=P00N3D_Y0U link=topic=246336.msg2075951#msg2075951 date=1204089570]
Idk how it happens but when you log from my server and log back in your able too use ::starter again, and again…etc.Anyway i can stop this from happening?
[/quote]
Since your server is built from Winterlove’s, it has multi threading for each Player connected. Each Player is it’s own Client object, and inside each Client, there is an integer set to 0. Each time you log out, and in, you get a new client object, hence the only way to do that would not to use an integer, but a HashSet/ArrayList. Just declare one in class Player, and add to it, invoking add(Object) every time someone uses the command.[/quote]

WTF are you talking about?

Read full topic

item.title: Using ::starter
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

P00N3D_Y0U:

Idk how it happens but when you log from my server and log back in your able too use ::starter again, and again…etc.Anyway i can stop this from happening?

Since your server is built from Winterlove’s, it has multi threading for each Player connected. Each Player is it’s own Client object, and inside each Client, there is an integer set to 0. Each time you log out, and in, you get a new client object, hence the only way to do that would not to use an integer, but a HashSet/ArrayList. Just declare one in class Player, and add to it, invoking add(Object) every time someone uses the command.

Read full topic

item.title: Using ::starter
item.dc:creator: @Kollidierende Kolli`
item.description:
@Kollidierende wrote:

Sure, just go into client.java and search for:

starter

I’m not sure if there is other starter’s in your client.java so just keep going until it goes down to the command, then take out the command.

Read full topic
